instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - flickering display
threads.message:
have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in with liquid damage, damage close and around SMC, Replaced SMC and damaged parts around, 

Everything worked fine until I booted it up, it has a flickering/ distortion on image, and there is no sound, 

any ideas of what the problem could be, 

thanks in advance!

video:

[url]https://youtu.be/Url3EBnYvRI[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - flickering display
threads.message:
It's going into sleep mode so <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is being pulled low. Probably corrosion on trackpad/connector/flat cable. Could be crap on/under the Hall sensor J6955 too.
All audio is on the IO board, so probably bad IO board and/or flat cable.
